title: (x) FIFA World Cup South Africa 2010 logo - customised Neuland {Jan E}
content:
Anyone know type used in Official Poster of the 2010 FIFA World Cup South-Africa

thanks

sorry for size image.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [poster2.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019131027/http:/typophile.com/files/poster2.jpg) | 12.86 KB |
author: canape

comments.content:
It shares similarities with Neuland/BT Informal 011 but still is quite different.  
I think it’s a custom design.

Oh, my brains.  
I actually replied to this same request before:

[http://www.typophile.com/node/34266](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019131027/http:/www.typophile.com/node/34266 "http://www.typophile.com/node/34266")

If this is the same typeface at the »first«(?) or original (?) version, I'd say it is a custom work done by Gabriel da Abreu from Swith Design (South Africa). See Jürgen Sieberts [Fontblog-topic ”That‘s the WC Logo from 2010«](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019131027/http:/www.fontblog.de/files/wm_2010_logo.html) (sorry, germanspeakers only).

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019131027im_/http:/typophile.com/files/page0_blog_entry324_1_3530.jpg)

BTW, I think Neuland is an excellent suggestion for a substitute, as always. The Neuland-typeface-concept is also known as Nueland or Phosphor and maybe more I don't know of.

There is another called [Othello](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019131027/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/othello-mt/) that is quite similar. From the same era as the original Neuland too.

- Mike Yanega
Sergio, could you please first do a search when you know what you're looking for? Don't worry, no harm done, but maybe next time... ;^)
